data.title: Option for "Open with Atom"
data.body: Is there an option to disable the "Open with Atom" shell entry? I can't find one, if there isn't, see this as a feature request :)

Uncaught Error: spawn xmllint ENOENT

**Atom Version**: 0.155.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.9.5
**Thrown From**: Atom Core

1. Opened up a file with an invalid path
2. Error spawned
### Stack Trace

```
At events.js:85

Error: spawn xmllint ENOENT
  at exports._errnoException (util.js:742:11)
  at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (child_process.js:1051:32)
  at child_process.js:1142:20
  at process._tickCallback (node.js:378:11)

```

data.title: SCSS :nth-child marked as syntax error
data.body:
In an SCSS file when you use the psuedo-selector `:nth-child` after the `&` selector atom sometimes marks the syntax as incorrect.

Examples:

1.
`&:nth-child(4n-1)`
`n-` is highlighted as a syntax error.

2.
`&:nth-child(4n+1)`
`n` is highlighted as a syntax error.

This does not happen after a standard css selector such as a class or element.

data.title: Improve middle mouse paste on Linux
data.body:
- Moves the cursor to the clicked location
- Ensures operations like backspace don't write to the selection clipboard

Closes #4296
Closes #4638
Closes #4677

data.title: Safemode returns undefined in new atom window
data.body:
If you open Atom and run atom.getLoadSettings().safeMode it returns true / false.
If you open another atom window(by opening new folder)  atom.getLoadSettings().safeMode returns undefined.

data.title: open file dialog does not show .apmrc file
data.body:
i have installed atom 64 bit for my openSUSE 13.2 box . i try to configure package manager to use proxy. i run `rpm -ql atom | grep .apmrc` so i know there exists a .apmrc file . but  open file dialog does not show this file.

```
> rpm -ql atom | grep .apmrc
/usr/local/share/atom/resources/app/apm/node_modules/atom-package-manager/.apmrc
```

data.title: atom.workspace.observeTextEditors does not pass editor
data.body:
I am trying to use `observeTextEditors` and I'm noticing some weird behaviour.

I'm aiming to have this:

``` coffee
  atom.workspace.observeTextEditors => @didOpenFile()

didOpenFile: (editor) ->
  ...
```

When I use that `editor` is undefined but it does work when using:

``` coffee
atom.workspace.observeTextEditors (editor) ->
      SassWatch = atom.packages.getActivePackage('sass-watch')?.mainModule
      SassWatch?.didOpenFile(editor)
```

it works fine.

Why isn't `editor` being passed to my function?

data.title: Editor behaves confusing while editing RTL text
data.body:
I can write Persian text (almost same as Arabic) in Atom even though it does not appear right to left. I can live with it, the problem is when I try to edit the text and I position the cursor somewhere inside the text and begin to type, the characters appear somewhere else, a few characters away.

To show you a good example of correct behavior I should mention _gedit_. Using _gedit_ to write Persian blog posts in markdown format, I have no problem entering and editing the text. Everything works as expected, I don't know which GUI component is being used in Atom and Gedit, probably that's the difference. Here are some screenshots showing the texts but I have no way to show the typing problem.

In Atom:
![Typing Persian in Atom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3101557/5486071/d7a93dfa-86a2-11e4-8cbb-9dc595dbaf25.png)

In gedit:
![The same text in gedit](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3101557/5486082/f9bd0566-86a2-11e4-96c6-1869da23f305.png)

data.title: Can't type : < > and = with Neo Keyboard Layout on Mac OS X
data.body:
I am running Atom 0.161.0 on Mac OS X Yosemite and use the [German Neo Layout](http://www.neo-layout.org/). Unfortunately I can't type the characters : < > and =. In other applications (Browser, Email and so forth) it works as expected.
I am aware of the issues atom/atom-keymap#35, #1625 and #3834 but these are only for the "right ALT" key.

data.title: Middle mouse paste inserts the most-recently deleted character
data.body: Middle mouse inserts the character that was deleted most recently, even if it was not selected. This is unexpected as other FreeDesktop-conformant applications do not consider deleted characters selected and do not show this behavior.

data.title: Document atom.grammars
data.body:
As of 0.161.0 the API docs don't mention `atom.grammars`, what it is, or what it can be used for: https://atom.io/docs/api/search/v0.161.0?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=atom.grammars

Nothing in the guides either: https://atom.io/docs/v0.161.0/search?q=atom.grammars

In #4259 @nathansobo states that it's "officially public" so it should at least be documented somewhere (and PRs adding new public stuff should probably have docs in them in the future too)

data.title: Atom doesn't work when launch without arguments
data.body:
Hi all !

I'm on windows : installed with the new installer on the website after doing a clean remove from chocolatey.

I have a weird problem : if i open atom from the commandline, with atom . or atom ./myfile , then everything work fine. If i open it from the desktop shortcut (or even right click open with atom) then, i can't write anything or create new files, and i've got a bunch of "module did not register" in the console from a load of module (all of them i guess ?)

It's a pretty weird bug, everything worked fine with my old chocolatey version.

data.title: generated sample app html question
data.body:
The generated sample app now generates the html programmatically.  This is obviously something no one would consider doing in real life.  This has two problems.  It doesn't show the idiomatic method and it is no good as a template to start adding to.

What is the idiomatic way?  Is there an equivalent way to space-pen?  There is a cool npm module call `teacup` which seems to be the inspiration for space-pen.  Has anyone tried that?

data.title: Avoid firing repeated config events while packages are loaded
data.body:
Refs #4666.
#### Problem

Currently, each scoped settings file or snippets file that is loaded from a package causes expensive events to be emitted on `atom.config`. Emitting these events is expensive because:
- The act of adding scoped settings clears the scoped settings cache
- Callbacks registered via `atom.config::onDidChange` or `::observe` receive the new property value as an argument. Computing the new value requires re-merging the scoped properties with an _empty cache_.

Merging scoped properties recently became more expensive due to deep-merging.
#### Solution

This adds a new method to `Config` called `::transact` which allow multiple config changes to be 'rolled up', firing only one change event.

Currently, I only use `::transact` in `PackageManager` when activating and deactivating packages. I think the snippets package should also use it when loading snippets files from packages.

/cc @benogle @kevinsawicki

data.title: 100% CPU consumption
data.body:
Since version 0.159.0 every time I start atom it consumes a 100% CPU and is kind of unusable. This does not happen in safe mode.
I haven't been able to figure out what package is causing this.

So with the same packages installed and enabled atom works well with version 0.158.0 and is unusable in 0.159.0 and 0.161.0 (haven't tried 0.160.0).

So I'd just like to ask if anything unusual changed in version 0.159.0?

I'm using 64bit atom on arch linux.
